image.altText: A woman with long bright red hair, wearing all black, walks down the street, smiling.

props.synopsis: Union boss Diana Asmar had a clear message for her branch: The traitors who'd betrayed her had no idea what was coming. But the leader herself took the fall.

title.children: 'Regret the day she was born': Labor powerbroker unseated by 'traitors'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese points and looks serious

props.synopsis: But the last election campaign exposed the true decline in the quality and capacity of the parliamentary Coalition — as well as its underlying party machines — to do politics and to do policy in a way which means it can't be assumed this is just a temporary flesh wound.

title.children: Self-induced idiocy has exposed the Coalition for the fractured beast it is

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in front of a screen and waves.

props.synopsis: Elon Musk has become a hero in some MAGA circles, but Democrats are moving to reverse the help they have given his electric car company in the past.

title.children: DOGE prompts New York leaders to threaten Tesla to get at Musk

image.altText: Aerial show of flood water across a highway.

props.synopsis: Weather conditions that have brought deadly flooding to New South Wales are beginning to ease but more than 30 emergency-level warnings remain in place. Follow live.

title.children: Authorities warn of ongoing danger as floodwaters subside in some parts

image.altText: Men getting into a boat on a flooded street.

props.synopsis: Mid North Coast residents rally together in "amazing" acts of community spirit, making rescues, setting up unofficial evacuation centres and delivering food to those in need.

title.children: Mates in tinny rescue dozens from flood in 'forgotten' NSW community

image.altText: Animation of a river cross-section showing how rainwater flows from the sky to the river in a flooding scenario.,

props.synopsis: Parts of NSW are experiencing some of their worst flooding on record. You'd be forgiven for thinking this is all about the rainfall. But it's not the only thing that matters.

title.children: How does half a metre of rain turn into 12 metres of flooding?

image.altText: Dead sea life under the water, grey clouds above the water

props.synopsis: A mysterious, brown foam appeared on a beach an hour south of Adelaide. It was just the beginning of a toxic algal bloom that has now grown to thousands of square kilometres in size, killing precious sea life in its wake. Experts say it could be a sign of things to come.

title.children: A mysterious brown foam appeared on a beach. Hours later, dead sea life followed

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: A web of messages, search histories, and reset phones has emerged in the Erin Patterson trial. But can digital evidence explain what happened at her dinner table?

title.children: Mother, cook, defendant: Trial of Erin Patterson turns to her personal life

image.altText: HESTA logo on a wall

props.synopsis: One HESTA member came close to losing his home deposit after struggling to access his super during a seven-week disruption to services. A consumer advocacy group has called for transparency around why the outage was approved.

title.children: Calls for more transparency as HESTA super outage continues

image.altText: harvard

props.synopsis: The move comes hours after the Ivy League school launched legal action against the US government over its attempts to stop the enrolment of students from overseas.

title.children: Judge blocks Trump administration's Harvard University enrolment ban

image.altText: Donald Trump with fist in the air

props.synopsis: US 10-year Treasury bonds have long been considered "risk-free" — until now. That's put the usually circumspect Reserve Bank of Australia "on alert" for a potentially "cataclysmic" economic event.

title.children: RBA on high alert for fallout as Trump continues to spook economy

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou holds a trophy

props.synopsis: In 2008, Ange Postecoglou was a Fox Sports pundit who felt unemployable. Now he's the first Australian football manager to win a major European club trophy.

title.children: Ange Postecoglou went from unemployable to a king of Europe

image.altText: Two hands adjusting some jeans as a sewing machine gets to work

props.synopsis: The national minimum wage in Australia is $24.10 and yet Ethical Clothing Australia says there are outworkers locally earning less than half of that to make the clothes you're wearing.

title.children: Exploited workers are making clothes for as little as $10 an hour

image.altText: Forensic experts work at Hamburg's main train station.

props.synopsis: German police have arrested a woman after a stabbing attack at the busy central train station in the German city of Hamburg that left multiple people injured, some of them in life-threatening condition.

title.children: Woman arrested after mass stabbing attack at Hamburg train station

image.altText: A young girl in an orange shirt smiling

props.synopsis: Police have expanded their search for missing Bundaberg teenager Pheobe Bishop, appealing for information on movement in the Good Night Scrub National Park.

title.children: What we know about the disappearance of 17yo Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: a Man looks at the camera as he walks through a heavy industrial area

props.synopsis: I suspect the world is divided into two groups: those who worship Star Wars and can spend hours arguing over the complexities of far-flung corners of its universe; and those who swipe left and close the app immediately they see that someone has mentioned George Lucas's creation as one of their great loves.

title.children: Star Wars's fascist dystopia has never felt closer

image.altText: The Aboriginal flag with an Aboriginal man appearing in front of it. There is white text over the top 'Black Kings Plea'

props.synopsis: Tucked away on a south-west Sydney riverbank is the site of a little-known story about a king at the centre of the Aboriginal civil rights movement.

title.children: Aboriginal king honoured in truth-telling launch

image.altText: A teenage boy with short brown hair wearing glasses and headphones holding an iPad and a sensory soft toy stands smiling.

props.synopsis: For neurodivergent children, going to the emergency department can be overstimulating so the Canberra Hospital has introduced a sensory-friendly room in the children's emergency area to make the experience less overwhelming.

title.children: Max gets overwhelmed in hospital. A sensory-friendly room hopes to help

image.altText: Models on a runway.

props.synopsis: According to the latest National Waste Report, the average Australian throws out about 11 kilograms of clothing each year. But what if some of that could be composted?

title.children: Paper clothes are turning heads and they're more durable than you think

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: The US president says he's "recommending" a 50 per cent tariff be put on goods from the European Union from June 1, because trade negotiations with the bloc are "going nowhere", and that Apple could face a 25 per cent penalty if iPhones aren't manufactured in America.

title.children: Trump takes aim at 'difficult' EU and iPhones with new tariff threat

image.altText: Photo of a man crouching down on a field.

props.synopsis: Australian farm productivity is in decline, prompting calls for policy reform as experts warn high yields are masking deeper issues.

title.children: The quiet Australian farming crisis you may not have heard about

image.altText: A man in a police uniform sorts through files in a storage unit

props.synopsis: The Italian Carabinieri Art Squad has recovered millions of stolen and fake artworks and artefacts since 1969, and its 300 specialist investigators are now using AI to combat the growing black market in the art world.

title.children: The Italian job — the forgery lab where Picassos are pirated

image.altText: A woman with long light brown hair in a white top with floral pattern stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: A company that manages at least 140 disability homes in Queensland is being accused of making misleading claims to property investors.

title.children: Retiree 'forced back to work' after investing in disability accommodation

image.altText: A large gorge.

props.synopsis: Mining company Rio Tinto blasted two 47,000-year-old rock shelters in 2020. An archaeologist says destruction continues "almost on a daily basis".

title.children: Five years on, experts say laws that allowed Juukan Gorge destruction remain

image.altText: warship

props.synopsis: The company is competing against a rival bid from Japan that is being heavily backed by Tokyo.

title.children: German company bids for $10 billion Australian warship contract

image.altText: Oscar Piastri standing side-on in the McLaren garage at the Monaco F1 Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Australia's championship leader Oscar Piastri goes into the tyre wall nose first at Sainte Devote, but still ends the day second fastest in practice at the Monaco F1 Grand Prix.

title.children: Piastri second fastest after 'messy' Monaco F1 practice

image.altText: man in a suit at a microphone

props.synopsis: Amid the chaos and confusion of this week's federal coalition breakdown, former television journalist David Crisafulli is acutely aware of the value of image and reputation, writes Alex Brewster.

title.children: Queensland premier keeps clear of Canberra Coalition chaos

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses and multiple pieces of jewellery looks down.

props.synopsis: Eight members of the 10-strong gang dubbed "grandpa robbers" have been found guilty over the violent armed robbery of Kim Kardashian in her Paris hotel in 2016.

title.children: 'Grandpa robbers' found guilty in Kim Kardashian Paris trial heist

image.altText: up close boat

props.synopsis: A man in Norway awoke to discover a huge container ship had run aground just metres from his house  — and he had slept through the commotion.

title.children: Norway cabin owner wakes to find cargo ship in his backyard

image.altText: Front view of portrait of caucasian teenager male watching a movie with headphones and eating popcorn on sofa in living room

props.synopsis: New research suggests the widespread marketing of junk food on social media is influencing the food choices of young people.

title.children: Social media is exposing teenagers to hundreds of junk food ads every week

image.altText: Mads Pedersen celebrates winning Giro d'Italia stage 13.

props.synopsis: Mads Pedersen wins his fourth stage of this year's Giro d'Italia after beating Wout van Aert to the line following a 180km ride from Rovigo to Vicenza.

title.children: Unstoppable Pedersen wins Giro stage 13, Del Toro extends lead

image.altText: A man leads a team out for a rugby league match

props.synopsis: North Sydney Oval kept the spirit of the Bears alive during their darkest hours. But what role can the famous old ground play in the foundation club's resurrection in Perth?

title.children: As North Sydney Oval stands eternal, the Bears live between past and future

image.altText: A woman in a red and white rugby jersey holds a rugby ball as two girls in green and yellow rugby jerseys chasing her.

props.synopsis: The Wallaroos have lost to world number two Canada a harsh pre-World Cup reminder at Lang Park.

title.children: Canada hammer Wallaroos in World Cup reality check

image.altText: Woman in blue shirt and pants sits on a stool smiling widely. She sits against a plain, grey background.

props.synopsis: ABC Classic presenter Megan Burslem hates the idea that classical music is just for some. She grew up fighting off that misunderstanding, and says the experience has given her a "superpower" she wants to share.

title.children: Why everyone deserves a front-row seat, no matter their postcode
